analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs tshod kyi 'dod pa rnams la rigs pa dang lung gang yang med de /

original: 'dir ni gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs bsam spros te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gzhung mangs kyis 'jigs bsam spros te /
translated: Here, fearing excessive length, I will not elaborate.

original: bzlog pa gnod pa med pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa gnod pa med pa yang de bzhin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du mtshon pa yang ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o zhes bla ma brgyud pa las bdag gis thos so zhes zer ro //

analyzed: de ltar phan yon dang ldan pa'i yongs su 'dzin pa'i bsnyen bkur bar gdams pa ni /

analyzed: de ltar yid la bya ba rgyun mi chad pas bsten par gyis shig ces gsungs te /

analyzed: yid la bya ba ni yon tan gyi sgo nas so //

original: ci ltar bsten zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar bsten zhe na /

analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas ni //

analyzed: sa lta bu'i sems dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: bskur ba ni rjes su bsgrub pa'o //

original: mi skyo ba ni sun par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi skyo ba ni sun par mi bya ba'o //

original: mi phyed pa ni bdud dang bdud kyi ris kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i gang zag gi rjes su mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa ni bdud dang bdud kyi ris kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i gang zag gi rjes su mi 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal ni tha mal pa'i las kyis dub pa'o //

original: mi 'gul ba ni g-yo bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'gul ba ni g-yo bar mi nus pa'o //

original: ci dga' ba ni ci ltar dgyes par bya'o //
analyzed: ci dga' ba ni ci ltar dgyes par bya'o //

analyzed: mi khro ba ni gus pa'i phyir rang bsten pa'o //

original: ci lta bus she na /
analyzed: ci lta bus she na /

analyzed: sngar bstan pa ltar gus pa'i sems ni bdag ni dad par 'du shes bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen kho na la gus pa ci'i phyir zhes te /

analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi rtsa ba yin pas zhes phan yon bstan pa ni /
translated: the benefits are taught with the passage beginning Because he is the root of all good qualities.

original: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The passage beginning Son in the lineage!

original: ri gangs can ni @285a * //
analyzed: ri gangs can ni @285a * //
translated: The snowy mountain

original: sman sna tshogs kyi gnas yin pas /
analyzed: sman sna tshogs kyi gnas yin pas /
translated: is the abode of various medicines.

analyzed: de dag yongs su 'phel ba ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang yon tan thams cad skye ba'i gnas yin pas gong du 'phel ba ni rnam par 'phel lo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Just as they flourish, the spiritual master is the abode of the arising of all good qualities. Thus, he is said to flourish, that is, to increase.

original: rgya mtsho chen po chu yongs su 'dzin pa ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang yon tan gyi snod yin par bstan pa ni snod du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po chu yongs su 'dzin pa ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang yon tan gyi snod yin par bstan pa ni snod du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: Just as the great ocean is the complete holder of water, the spiritual master is taught to be the vessel of good qualities. Thus, he is said to become a vessel.

analyzed: de ltar ma thob pa'i yon tan thob pa dang / thob pa mi nyams shing 'phel ba'i khyad par bstan nas de nyid mdor na bsdu ba ni mdor na zhes gsungs te /

original: thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //

original: chos ni stobs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos ni stobs la sogs pa ste /

analyzed: yongs su 'grub pa ni mi nyams pa'o //

original: kha na las pa ni lung las so //
analyzed: kha na las pa ni lung las so //

original: byung ba ni sgrub pa dang ldan pa las so //
analyzed: byung ba ni sgrub pa dang ldan pa las so //

original: de ni yon tan nyams pa sor chud par byed pa'i phan yon bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de ni yon tan nyams pa sor chud par byed pa'i phan yon bstan pa ni /

analyzed: 'od srungs zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: shing leb ni gru'i tshal pa ci yang rung ba'am mi ro la sogs pa'o //

original: 'gram ni ngogs so //
analyzed: 'gram ni ngogs so //

original: dpe de nyid sbyar ba ni de bzhin du zhes pa ste /
analyzed: dpe de nyid sbyar ba ni de bzhin du zhes pa ste /

analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems ni rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa'i smon pa'i sems so //
translated: Likewise, the thought of omniscience is the aspirational thought that desires complete enlightenment.

original: zhig pa'i sems ni nyams par byed pa'i chos bzhi thun tshod las 'das pa dang / sems can yal bar dor ba dang / byang chub tu smon pa gtang ba'o //
analyzed: zhig pa'i sems ni nyams par byed pa'i chos bzhi thun tshod las 'das pa dang / sems can yal bar dor ba dang / byang chub tu smon pa gtang ba'o //
translated: The mind of destruction is destroyed by four dharmas: transgression of the rules, neglect of sentient beings, giving up the vow of enlightenment, and transgression of the rules of the community.

original: byang chub ni 'bras bu ste thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub ni 'bras bu ste thob par bya ba'o //

original: nyams pa ni rgyu spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams pa ni rgyu spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Destruction is the cause, the abandonment.

original: 'on kyang yongs su 'dzin pa la brten nas /
analyzed: 'on kyang yongs su 'dzin pa la brten nas /
translated: But it is restored by means of the vow.

original: sor chud par 'gyur ba ni gang zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa'i sems rab tu thob pa ni /
analyzed: sor chud par 'gyur ba ni gang zhes gsungs pa yin no // thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems rab tu thob pa ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i las so //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i las so //
translated: The attainment of the mind of omniscience is the function of the stage of action in faith.

original: chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sa bcu la 'das nas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi pha rol tu son pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sa bcu la 'das nas so //
translated: The perfection of all dharmas is the perfection of the ten perfections after passing through the ten stages.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid do //
translated: The realm of the Dharma is the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: phyin pa ni mngon du mdzad pa ste mngon par sangs rgyas pa'o //üîΩde nyid mdor bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: phyin pa ni mngon du mdzad pa ste mngon par sangs rgyas pa'o // de nyid mdor bsdus pa ni /
translated: To arrive is to manifest, to be fully enlightened.üîΩThis is summarized in the following verse.

original: de bas na zhes gtan tshigs su bstan pas don bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes gtan tshigs su bstan pas don bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the summary is taught by way of reason.

original: de ltar bla na yod pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa phan yon dang bcas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bla na yod pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa phan yon dang bcas pa bstan pa'o //

analyzed: bla na med pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa'i tshul bstan pa ni /

original: bla na med pa zhes gsungs te /üîΩ'dir yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par gnyis smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes gsungs te / 'dir yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par gnyis smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: the one who is present and the one who is not present.üîΩ Why are two types of spiritual teacher mentioned here?üîΩ Because two types of object for generating the Thought have been taught above.üîΩThe one who is present is taught as being the spiritual teacher who is to be relied upon for practice.

original: gong du sems bskyed pa'i yul gnyis bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gong du sems bskyed pa'i yul gnyis bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The one who is not present is taught as being the spiritual teacher who is to be relied upon for the unsurpassed.üîΩ What is the one who is present and what is the one who is not present?üîΩ The one who is present is the one who is to be relied upon for practice.

original: @285b yul yod pa las blang ba ni bsgrub pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: @285b yul yod pa las blang ba ni bsgrub pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bya bar bstan to //
translated: The one who is not present is the one who is to be relied upon for the unsurpassed.üîΩ What is the one who is present and what is the one who is not present?üîΩ The one who is not present is the one who is to be relied upon for the unsurpassed.üîΩThe one who is present is the one who is to be relied upon for practice.

original: yul med pa las blangs par bstan pa ni bla na med pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis so //
analyzed: yul med pa las blangs par bstan pa ni bla na med pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis so //

analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the one who is present and what is the one who is not present?üîΩ The one who is present is the one who is to be relied upon for practice.

original: gal te don chen po nyams par 'gyur ba nges pa las ni rgyang grags kyi mthar yang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te don chen po nyams par 'gyur ba nges pa las ni rgyang grags kyi mthar yang med pa nyid do //
translated: The one who is not present is the one who is to be relied upon for the unsurpassed.üîΩ What is the one who is present and what is the one who is not present?üîΩ The one who is present is the one who is to be relied upon for practice.üîΩThe one who is not present is the one who is to be relied upon for the unsurpassed.üîΩ What is the one who is present and what is the one who is not present?üîΩ The one who is present is the one who is to be relied upon for practice.

analyzed: ma nges pa las ni dpag tshad brgya'i pha rol tu yang yod pa nyid do //
translated: The one who is not present is the one who is to be relied upon for the unsurpassed.üîΩ What is the one who is present and what is the one who is not present?üîΩ The one who is present is the one who is to be relied upon for practice.

analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ci dngos po'i stobs kyis sam 'on te bsam pa'i dbang gis 'dod ce na /

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis te /

analyzed: theg pa chen po ni dngos po'i dbang gis gzhag par 'dod kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no //
translated: The Mahayana is taught by the power of things, not by the power of thought.

original: de ci ltar shes she na /
analyzed: de ci ltar shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: lung brgyud pa las te /
analyzed: lung brgyud pa las te /
translated: It is known from the transmission of scripture.üîΩIf it were taught by the power of thought, then how could the qualities of the Mahayana be established by the power of things, since the power of thought would be the primary factor?

original: gal te bsam pa'i dbang gis 'grub na gang la 'du shes nye bar bzhag pa dang ma bzhag pa las yon tan dang nye ba dngos po'i dbang gis ji ltar gzhag 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin pa la ni dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jigs par mi
analyzed: gal te bsam pa'i dbang gis 'grub na gang la 'du shes nye bar bzhag pa dang ma bzhag pa las yon tan dang nye ba dngos po'i dbang gis ji ltar gzhag 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po yin pa la ni dngos po'i stobs kyis 'jigs par mi
translated: It would not be logical for the Mahayana to be established by the power of things.

analyzed: dngos po'i dbang gis tha ma nyid der bshad // ces lung bsdus pa las gsungs so //

analyzed: ha cang spros pas da ni dkyus ma nyid la 'jug par bya'o // bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dge ba'i don dam las dge ba mya ngan las 'das pa'o //

analyzed: lung las kyang sbyin pa nas shes rab kyi bar du gsal bar gsungs pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de'i phyir bsam pa'i rang bzhin go cha'i tshogs kyi sa nas 'jug pa brgyud pa sbyor ba'i lam las bsgom par bya ba yin te /

original: de'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid ni ;
analyzed: de'i gang zag gi mtshan nyid ni ;
translated: The characteristics of the person who does this are

analyzed: gang dag ces gsungs pa yin te /

analyzed: 'chad pa lta bu'o //

original: dman pa la mos pa 'ga' zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin mi shes pas 'dus byas kyis thob pa dang bral ba 'dus ma byas pa'i rjes yin no zhes zer la /

translated: Some persons of inferior aspiration, not understanding the nature of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs nirvana, say that it is a non-entity, like the son of a barren woman.üîΩOthers, bound by the view of entities, say that it is like the dissolution of a cloud in the sky.

analyzed: la la na re nam mkha'i sprin dengs pa lta bur gyur to zhes dngos por lta bas bcings par ji lta bar mi shes pas rgol ba ni /

analyzed: nges par legs pa'i chos dag ni //

analyzed: de thob pa gang la yod pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //

original: de yang cis shes she na /
analyzed: de yang cis shes she na /

analyzed: rang gi rtog ge ma yin pas mdo sde las shes zhes bya ba'o //

analyzed: mdo nyid nges pa'i don du bstan pas /

analyzed: du ma zhes smos so ;

analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras zhes gsungs te /

original: dang po rang bzhin gyi sgo nas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dang po rang bzhin gyi sgo nas bstan pa ni /

analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid la blo yongs su btang ste zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is said, having relinquished the mind to the nature itself.

original: rang bzhin gyi ni chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi ni chos kyi dbyings so //

original: ngo bo nyid ni de'i rang bzhin bstan te de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni de'i rang bzhin bstan te de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'o //

original: blo yongs su btang ba ni shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad nas so //
analyzed: blo yongs su btang ba ni shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad nas so //
translated: Relinquishing the mind is to analyze with prajna.

original: ci ltar dpyad ce na /üîΩyod par lta ba ni dngos po'i mtha' yin la /
analyzed: ci ltar dpyad ce na / yod par lta ba ni dngos po'i mtha' yin la /
translated: How is it analyzed?üîΩThe view of existence is the extreme of entities.

original: med par lta ba ni chad pa'i mtha' yin pas /
analyzed: med par lta ba ni chad pa'i mtha' yin pas /
translated: The view of nonexistence is the extreme of annihilation.

original: dngos po dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dbu ma'i lam la shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang chad pa'i mtha' dang bral ba dbu ma'i lam la shes rab kyis yongs su zin pa'o //
translated: It is the middle way, which is free from the extremes of existence and non-existence, and is fully embraced by wisdom.

original: 'dzin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni nges par 'byed pa'o //

original: de la yod par lta ba ni phyi dang nang gis mu stegs pa 'ga' zhig rtag pa dang / kha cig mi rtag pa la sogs par lta ba dang / rdul phra rab rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid du lta ba ste /

translated: The view of existence is the view of some non-Buddhists, such as the Samkhyas, that the external and internal are permanent, and the view of some non-Buddhists, such as the Ajivikas, that they are impermanent, and the view of the Vaibhasikas that the subtle particle is the essence of substance.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dang / btsun pa dge 'dun srung dang / mdo sde pa dag na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dang / btsun pa dge 'dun srung dang / mdo sde pa dag na re /

analyzed: rdul phra rab sbyar @288b ba dang bskor ba dang bar mtshams med par 'dod pa dag go //
translated: the subtle particle is extended, surrounded, and without interstices.

original: chad par lta ba ni yang dag pa'i dngos po gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba gnyis su med pa'i shes pa rang bzhin gcig pa'i ngo bo yang med par lta ba dag ste /

translated: The view of annihilation is the view that the real entity, which is free from the grasped and the grasper, the non-dual consciousness, and the essence of a single nature, does not exist.

original: 'di gnyis ni dngos po dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' ste mtha' de gnyis dang bral ba ni dbu ma'i lam yang dag pa'i don gyi de kho na nyid chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni dngos po dang chad par lta ba'i mtha' ste mtha' de gnyis dang bral ba ni dbu ma'i lam yang dag pa'i don gyi de kho na nyid chos kyi dbyings zhes bya'o //
translated: These two are the extremes of the views of substantialism and nihilism. Freedom from these two extremes is the middle way, the reality of the perfect meaning, the expanse of reality.

original: de nyid ma bcos shing rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ba med pas de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ma bcos shing rang bzhin gyis 'gyur ba med pas de bzhin nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That itself is uncontrived and naturally unchanging, so it is called ‚Äúsuchness.‚Äù

original: dngos por lta ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: dngos por lta ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pas /
translated: The view of substantialism is not correct,

original: dngos po dang bral ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang bral ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyis yang dag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: so freedom from substantialism is the perfect limit in the sense of being the unmistaken meaning.

original: spros pa rnams ni blo yis byas pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin pas blo'i yul du ma gyur pas dbyer med pa'i don gyis spros pa med pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
analyzed: spros pa rnams ni blo yis byas pa'i phyir tha dad pa yin pas blo'i yul du ma gyur pas dbyer med pa'i don gyis spros pa med pa ni chos kyi dbyings te /
translated: Since elaborations are different because they are created by the mind, they are not the object of the mind, so the meaning of being indivisible is the expanse of reality, which is free from elaborations.

original: yon tan bskyed pa'i phyir dh'a tu ste khams kyi don to //
analyzed: yon tan bskyed pa'i phyir dh'a tu ste khams kyi don to //
translated: Since it is the source of the generation of good qualities, it is the dhƒÅtu, meaning the element.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dus ma byas shing rang bzhin gyis stong pas nam mkha'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyis 'dus ma byas shing rang bzhin gyis stong pas nam mkha'o //
translated: Since it is not produced by causes and conditions and is empty by nature, it is space.

original: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba ni snga ma ltar byas pa ma yin pas rang bzhin dang ngo //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba ni snga ma ltar byas pa ma yin pas rang bzhin dang ngo //
translated: The essence of phenomena, free from apprehended object and apprehending subject, is not as it was previously described, and so it is their nature.

original: spang bar bya ba dang gnyen po ni btags pas gzhag pas de kho na nyid du 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas dang / 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal snga nas kyis /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba dang gnyen po ni btags pas gzhag pas de kho na nyid du 'phags pa klu sgrub kyi zhal snga nas dang / 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal snga nas kyis /
translated: Since object of abandonment and antidote are posited by imputation, the noble NƒÅgƒÅrjuna and the noble Maitreya say:

original: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
analyzed: 'di la bsal bya ci yang med //
translated: Here there is nothing at all to be removed,

original: bsnan par bya ba cung zad med //üîΩyang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
analyzed: bsnan par bya ba cung zad med // yang dag nyid la yang dag lta //
translated: not the slightest thing to be added.üîΩJust this is to be purified:

original: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //
analyzed: yang dag mthong na rnam par grol //
translated: by seeing the real, one is liberated.

original: zhes don dam pa la spang ba dang spong byed med pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha'o //
analyzed: zhes don dam pa la spang ba dang spong byed med pas 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha'o //
translated: Since in the ultimate there is neither abandonment nor object of abandonment, it is the limit of freedom from attachment.

original: snang ba rnams ni sems nyid las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don med de de'i phyir na /üîΩ'phags pa nyid kyis ;
analyzed: snang ba rnams ni sems nyid las ma gtogs pa'i phyi rol gyi don med de de'i phyir na / 'phags pa nyid kyis ;
translated: Appearances are not external objects apart from mind itself, and so the noble one himself says:

original: 'byung ba che la sogs bshad pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba che la sogs bshad pa //
translated: The elements and so on that are explained

original: rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
analyzed: rnam par shes su yang dag 'du //
translated: are completely included within consciousness.

original: de shes pas ni 'bras 'gyur la //
analyzed: de shes pas ni 'bras 'gyur la //
translated: By knowing that, the result will be attained.

original: log par rnam brtags ma yin nam //
analyzed: log par rnam brtags ma yin nam //
translated: Is it not a false imagination?

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal snga nas kyang /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / 'phags pa byams pa'i zhal snga nas kyang /
translated: And the noble Maitreya says:

original: bdag dang chos su gter 'dod pas //
analyzed: bdag dang chos su gter 'dod pas //
translated: Those who desire to find treasure in the self and phenomena

original: sna tshogs dag ni gang byung ba //
analyzed: sna tshogs dag ni gang byung ba //
translated: Whatever variety arises

original: da ni rnam par shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: da ni rnam par shes par 'gyur //
translated: is now known to be consciousness.

original: gyur pa de yang rnam gsum ste //
analyzed: gyur pa de yang rnam gsum ste //
translated: And that transformation is threefold:

original: rnam par smin dang ngar sems dang // yul la rnam par rig pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin dang ngar sems dang // yul la rnam par rig pa'o //
translated: The transformation of the basis, the transformation of support,üîΩAnd the transformation of objects.

original: zhes rab tu byed pa sum cu pa las gsungs pa lta bu'i don gyi rmi lam gyi mtha'o //
analyzed: zhes rab tu byed pa sum cu pa las gsungs pa lta bu'i don gyi rmi lam gyi mtha'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the dream example in the Thirty Verses.

original: chos nyid la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad de @289a * //
analyzed: chos nyid la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid mi 'thad de @289a * //
translated: The ultimate reality is not tenable as the general or particular characteristics of things,

original: yongs su grub pa ni gzung 'dzin dang bral bas mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni gzung 'dzin dang bral bas mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: because the perfected nature is without characteristics, being free from subject and object.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa las byung ba khams gsum gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ni chags pa ste dngos por zhen ces bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa las byung ba khams gsum gyi sems dang sems las byung ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ni chags pa ste dngos por zhen ces bya ba'i don te /
translated: The dependent nature, which arises from unreal imagination, is the characteristics of the mind and mental factors of the three realms, and it is attachment, which means clinging to things.

original: de nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes kyi ma skyes par khong du chud pas chags pa med pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyin ci ma log pa'i ye shes kyi ma skyes par khong du chud pas chags pa med pa'i mtha'o //
translated: Since one realizes that the non-arising of that very thing is the unerring pristine wisdom, it is the extreme of non-attachment.

original: phung po dang de las gzhan par yod par mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: phung po dang de las gzhan par yod par mi 'thad pas /
translated: Since it is not tenable that the aggregates exist as something other than that,

analyzed: gang zag tu lta ba rnams ni med pa'i don gyis bdag gi rang bzhin gyi mtha'o //
translated: the views of the person are the extreme of the self-existence of the non-existent object.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid chos su lta ba rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas na /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid chos su lta ba rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bas na /
translated: Since the views of the phenomena of the nature of the apprehended and the apprehender are free from the nature of singularity and multiplicity in form and so forth,

original: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid med pas na mtha' ste stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin te ngo bo nyid med pas na mtha' ste stong pa nyid do //
translated: the nature of all phenomena is the extreme of emptiness, which is the lack of inherent existence.

original: ci lta ba bzhin zhes pa ni de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong gi yod pas bshigs pa lta bu ma yin pas so //
analyzed: ci lta ba bzhin zhes pa ni de dag thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong gi yod pas bshigs pa lta bu ma yin pas so //

original: dam bca' ba tsam ni ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bca' ba tsam ni ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere thesis is not refuted,

original: gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod do //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod do //
translated: but there is another valid cognition that causes damage.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal bar smra ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po dang / dngos po med pa dag ni phan tshun 'gal bar smra ba ma yin nam /
translated: Are not things and nonthings said to be mutually exclusive?

original: 'di las lhag pa gang gis dngos po mi brdzun la /
analyzed: 'di las lhag pa gang gis dngos po mi brdzun la /
translated: What is more, how could a thing be false?

original: de med pa ni yang dag pa yin /
analyzed: de med pa ni yang dag pa yin /
translated: And how could its nonexistence be real?

original: tshad ma thams cad kyi nang nas mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: tshad ma thams cad kyi nang nas mngon sum gyi tshad ma ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: Of all the valid cognitions, direct perception is the most important.

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yang dbang po nyid gtso bo yin pas thams cad la gsal bar snang ba go ci ltar bzlog ces /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma yang dbang po nyid gtso bo yin pas thams cad la gsal bar snang ba go ci ltar bzlog ces /
translated: And since the sense faculties are the most important among the valid cognitions of direct perception, how can you refute the fact that all things clearly appear to them?

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rgol ba la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na zhes rgol ba la /
